Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: pionier

German

[edit]
German Wikipedia has an article on:
Pionier
Wikipedia de

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed in the 17th century from French pionnier, a soldier employed to form roads, dig trenches, and make bridges, as an army advances.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Rhymes: -iːɐ̯

Noun

[edit]

Pionier m (strong, genitive Pioniers, plural Pioniere, feminine Pionierin)

  1. pioneer, trailblazer (fig.) (male or of unspecified gender)
  2. sapper, engineer (army engineer, combat engineer, military engineer) (male or of unspecified gender)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Pionier [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Pionier die Pioniere
genitive eines des Pioniers der Pioniere
dative einem dem Pionier den Pionieren
accusative einen den Pionier die Pioniere

Synonyms

[edit]
  • Wegbereiter
  • Vorkämpfer
  • Vorreiter
